content: Awsome game.
Not bad, it needs more maps like the pc version though.
Kurang maps
Practice makes perfect
Rubbish. Over priced. Hardly any levels. DRL on computer miles better that is a true simulator.
One of my all time favorite sims! Been using since beta u need this fpv piolets! Use with your radio and goggles!
Sucks big time! Its laggy even with the settings on its lowest i really liked part 1 but this was a big disappointment 😔

I have to give back the two stars cause when I switched phones I did lose my original GOOGLE account I have purchased the recharged version a few months ago was playing every day trying to save up for a good transmitter and now I have to buy the. Recharged version again and it's worth every penny so here are the 2 stars back I am so happy I can fly again. So sorry that I took the stars you guys are awsome wish I could fly with other pilots thou have actual races and maybe some diff quads thx
replyContent: If you are using the same Google account you shouldn't have to buy it again. The purchase is linked to your Google account. Please contact the Google Play store, I'm sure they will be able to help. (As a developer I do not have direct control over downloads/purchases).

content: Can't mix yaw and roll. Defaults are horrible and basic levels are extremely limited. *edit in response to developer response* I don't mean custom mixes. I mean inputting yaw on the left (mode 2) 'gimbal' and roll on the right... The inputs do not combine.
replyContent: If you need special mixing, I would suggest to do it in the settings of the transmitter itself. You can adjust the default settings to your liking and save your own presets. You can edit the levels and create your own in the level editor.

content: Top Shelf 😎

The UI is horrible. It's like an unfinished product. Clearly shows the developer do not put even tiny effort in designing the UI. Some UI button I have to touch many times to successfully register the touch on the button. It's crazy tiny button. Not worth at all.
I love it!, can I install it with the same license on windows?
replyContent: Glad you like it! They Windows/Mac version is separate and needs to be purchased separately. I set the price low enough so that people will be able to afford both versions though.

content: Laggy and not enjoying play, even in performance mode and low resolutions in Huawei Nova 5T, already turn off and on SSAO still laggy, I think this app not recommended for huawei device specificly Kirin CPU
replyContent: Sorry to hear that it is not running well on your phone, it seems like it's a pretty common issue on some Huawei phones.

content: Awesome graphics and physics. Just the menu needs some adaptation to mobile screens as it's difficult to tap those tiny buttons.
Edit from my original 5 star review: The game freezes in the menu. Either when I click the map or the calibrate USB controller. I tried reinstalling but it didn't help.
replyContent: It's probably because the extension file did not get downloaded during installation. Please try to clear the data and cache of the app, uninstall and then reinstall again. If the problem persists, please contact the Google Play store and let them know that the extension file doesn't get downloaded on your phone, I hope they will be able to help.

content: First of all, I really like this simulator, but for the last few weeks it has been giving me problems calibrating my jumper t16. I have to uninstall and reinstall for me to calibrate, furthermore, if by some chance i dont need to uninstall the dots for my cal are all over the place.
Looks beautiful. Plays amazing on my note 9 (highest graphic setting). Setting up my taranis with the app was easier than DRL sim. Solid mobile fpv app. Thank you devs!
I haven't bought it yet butit is great

I realllllyyy like this sim and I really recommend you to keep working on it, this sim has lots of potential, like multiplayer, imagine this, the game gets so well known we could just host races like drl does, that would be awesome. And where can I suggest stuff to be added? Because I have some ideas that everyone would want for sure
This is the best one of the best fpv simulator
Love it,thks guys..
Best android fpv flight sim ! Maps are transferable pc <=> android so it's awesome. Default maps are pretty computing intensive, so alter them, make your own, or download the one people made !
Very smooth and realistic
replyContent: Thank you, glad you like it!

content: Love it, have the original of course.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and for supporting FPV Freerider!

content: Possible to add maps from the $2.99 version please, more practice in different locations would be great
replyContent: It is possible to add the custom maps. You need to copy them to the correct folder on your Android device. It is usually "/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.Freeride.FreeriderRecharged/files/", there is more info in the user manual, a link is in the app description here on Google Play.

content: On an Apple laptop I'd give this 5 stars on an Android 1 star you can calibrate the controls but it still won't do anything and the same controller can work on my MacBook and my iMac
replyContent: Make sure you have a USB OTG cable (It is not the same as a regular USB cable)

content: Great app, but my transmitter seems to very rapidly drain my phone's battery, very suddenly dropping to zero once the transmitter is unplugged... No idea why. No fault of the app at all, but worth mentioning if you have a jumper t16 or your transmitter supports charging through the cable.
replyContent: Thank you for the information. As you have guessed it must be that the transmitter is charging through the phone. Nothing FPV Freerider can do about that, perhaps there is a settings that you can change on the transmitter itself?

content: Would give 5 but after 3 restarts the app just shuts down and reopen. Sucks thats t h e game i paid for
Fun, and good practice, but the maps are a bit small
replyContent: Thank you for the review. In the included level editor you can make bigger maps yourself if you want to.

content: Perfect trainer without the rebuild costs. I am fairly new to quads but only fly in stability mode at present. I want to learn acro and this is the perfect tool. It allows you to set rates if you like cinewoop flying or all out racing style. Yes it's a simulator and a good one at that. After purchasing this I went straight to their website to purchase the mac version. (windows available) this is well worth the purchase as it allows you to connect your transmitter 5 star devs!!
replyContent: Thank you for your review and support, I'm glad you like the simulator!

content: Really enjoy getting some practice using my taranis Q X7 but is there any way to use the settings to get any more realism using gravity and mass
replyContent: You can try to play around with the settings on the Custom Settings screen, I would recommend staring with one of the presets and make changes from there.

content: So much fun love every bit of this game. The one thing I would like to see is custom map download for this game so people can share there maps. But every thing else gets a 20/10
replyContent: Thank you for your review and suggestion. I agree it would be nice to have an automatic sharing feature, for now you can manually fly other people maps by copying them to the correct folder on your Android device, usually "/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.Freeride.FreeriderRecharged/files/", there is more info in the user manual.

content: I want to like this game but it is buggy on android. If i play a map and then leave, the control sticks disappear and i can't do anything when i try either the same or other maps. Also the rate sliders are a joke, i cannot get the correct rates i want because that slider is waaaaaay too sensitive! Just let us type in our numbers please!! I will consider a refund otherwise. Wish it worked out like it has for others :/ EDIT: i bought this intending to use screen touch controls. Its stuck on usb
replyContent: You can cycle between the USB/touchscreen input on the main menu. I know the settings sliders can be a bit tricky to change since they are so small on a phone screen, perhaps you can use a bluetooth mouse for some fine adjustments.

content: Fantastic Sim it seems like. I'm VERRRY new to FVP drones and have been having trouble getting the hang of things. My cheap $100 NewBeeDrone has taken a beating in the process until I found this app. Excellent way to learn drone flight without destroying your equipment. My only desire would be larger scale maps and perhaps some more customization of the settings. Works flawlessly on my device, though, and the map editor is a very cool touch.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and feedback!

content: Nice game
Definitely the best drone simulator on the app Store. Thanks and all the best.
replyContent: Thanks, glad you like it!

content: Good for learning

I really enjoy this simulator. The dynamics are accurate and it flys like the real deal. Im sure ive saved thousands in crashes on here instead of real quads. It would be cool to be able to choose different quads, tiny whoops, and whatnot, but thats not a complaint that we cant.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and suggestions!

content: Didn't take long to decide to purchase this, after playing with the free version, I was impressed, now I've got the paid version, everything is so much more visually appealing and physically accurate. Now I don't have to worry about trashing my real drone, just practicing without stress. Fantastic performance on my Samsung Tab 6. Keep up the good work devs.
replyContent: Thank you for the review, I'm glad you like the simulator!

content: Great for practice fpv flying as I don't have pc. Just hook up your transmitter and your away. This is how I learned to fly.
replyContent: Thank you for the review, I'm glad to hear you like it and that it has been useful!

content: Meow 🐈
Awesome as usual 1- add 2 more channels for resetting and turtle mode 2- multiplayer (phantom mode or true online)

Amazing game and although ive had issues with it on my device due to my operating software update I've decided to download this onto my PC where I can now use my FPV goggles aswell and my controller for more accurate training. Wouldn't hesitate to download this onto my phone again once the issues are resolved.
replyContent: You might need to try to clear the app data and cache before uninstall/reinstall. FPV Freerider uses extension files which are downloaded during installation, without them it will not work.

content: Loved both games but after the upgrade to android 10 it just says loading after clicking any of the maps. Old game still works. S9 plus
replyContent: You can try to clear the cache and data of the app. Then uninstall, and reinstall the app and hopefully that will help.

content: Running on my oppo Reno phone Flysky nivana And a cheep pair of VR goggles from Amazon Can't really fault this simm it's got an inpresive feel and very well thought out platforms to hone you skills. I've been flying RC for many years now turned to FPV freestyle and this makes a fun a training tool and great FPV simm for the winter Easy set up Thanks John
replyContent: Thank you for your review, glad you like it!

content: Awesome simulator, I can use my taranis x9lite for stick control . And it helps me a lot for practicing fpv freestyle
I love this game very much so but I can't play with my headphones in as it dont rotate on screen which is a pain for me but hey ho game is good

Old ones better nothing new in this one I have all of them and I dont see a recharge in this one all they did was add diff maps which could be built in the 1st ones map editor complete waste of money if I could get a refund I deff would and just stick with the 1st freerider if you want diff maps this is ok but if you have the old one it's not worth the so called upgrade...

Great simulator, i bought the original more than a year ago and now that one, awesome simulator and levels, loved especially the editor. I wish you add the option to import levels and open source the level editor, i can make a beutiful marketace for share levels. It would be amazing to see what people do there.
replyContent: Thank your for your support and feedback, I agree it would be nice to be able to share/import levels more easily. It's something I would like to include if I can come up with a good solution for it.

content: Awesome sim. Just hope it's easier using an actual transmitter instead of touch screen.
replyContent: Thank you. Yes, it's a lot easier and more fun to fly using an actual transmitter.

content: Good game but lacks the performance and graphic of the first freerider. Especially I hate the trees.why on the best graphic it still looks terrible. Make it like the two towers on first freerider.
replyContent:
In order to get best performance on most devices I mostly used simple trees. However there are more detailed trees available in the level editor. Here you can download some of the levels with more detailed trees: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Yq4OwlICd3uN0B_JQ2eJkEHSzI8atwAf
You need to place them in the correct folder, see the manual for info.

content: Missing one thing. Unlike classic freerider I cant invert my controls. Game runs great otherwise but I dont want to change my habits to play on my phone. Hope this will be in an update. Edit: ah you're right. I believe I was making my controller invert the controls on classic.
replyContent: The USB controls can be inverted on the trim settings screen, like in freerider classic. The touchscreen controls can be selected as mode 1,2,3 or 4, but it can not be inverted, it's the same in freerider classic.

content: Excellent, been with fpv freerider since I started flying! one thing PLEASE ADD THE MULTI LEVEL PARKING GARAGE, PLEASE! That level alone made the game for me so much fun!!!!! :)
replyContent: Hi, The Carpark level is available in the classic version of FPV Freerider (it's also available here on Google Play).

content: Best FPV simulator ever. Waitting for new levels.

replyContent: Thank you for your review!

content: Awesome game perfect to get the hang of it before you start investing money in a real fpv drone. Wish they had more maps tho.. and bigger!
replyContent:
Thank you for the review! Well that's the beauty of the level editor, that you can create as many maps as you want, and make them as large as you want. You can even share them with others although you need to do it manually (by posting on forums for example).
Glad you like it!

content: Works great and feels pretty real, likeing the bando's. Appreciate the love sent out to us Android folks. I asked someone if velocidrone could be run on a chromebook and they laughed, usb phone charger plus turnigy evolution and I'm having repair free flights.

Runs perfectly at max settings on my note9. New maps are great, graphics fooled my friends (they thought I was streaming from a pc), and setup couldn't be easier. The last thing this sim could use is data entry boxes instead of sliders for rates - it'd be pretty much perfect after that.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and feedback! It's funny your friends thought you were streaming from a PC, great compliment :)

content: Just as amazing as the original. Controls and physics feel exactly the same (old custom settings still feel good). Awesome set of maps and finally a map editor 🤘😎. The first sim I always recommend to those getting into the hobby.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and support, glad you like it!

content: That time of the year again..good flying days are few and far between. FPV Freerider is my go-to portable sim great for those quick "fixes" 😉 (you will never get a "real feel" or accuracy on a touchscreen but it's probably as close as you can get). Now we have the Recharge Version for Android and it's even better - I have been playing it on my S6 Tab with my stadia controller and it's amazing 👍👍 ps I am not affiliated in any way with the developer just a huge fan of the Freerider Series
replyContent: Thank you for your review! Glad to hear it's working well on your setup.

content: Beautiful on highest settings on S8+
replyContent: Thanks, glad to hear it's working well!

content: Great sim, weird using no sticks and just touching a phone screen but it's something I just need to get used to. Controls are responsive and it's a great time killer.
replyContent: Thanks, yes, using a physical controller (preferably an actual RC radio connected via USB OTG) is highly recommended, it gives so much better control.

content: Great simulator. Really good to train you brain flying FPV on the go if you use, for instance, an usb tethered frsky radio. The main issue is that it should simulate the FOV of the typical fatsharks goggles, with an FOV of around 40º, but it works full screen with cardboard, so you get major motion sicknesses and is not playable... Please reduce the images to a smaller rectangle when using cardboard and it will be the best on the go FPV sim. Thank you
replyContent: Thank you for review and feedback, I will take a note of your suggestion and consider it.

content: So happy to see this on Android. Hard to fly on phone controls but great once you connect a drone controller. Runs great on my Note 8.
replyContent: Thanks, glad to hear that you appreciate it and that is runs well on your phone.

content: Great simulator! Starting as someone who had never flown before this has been exactly what i was looking for. It is challenging, but that is the point! There is lots of adjustment to set rates, camera angle and FOV so you can see what you like or push them to learn to fly new rates. The level editor is amazing, you can build almost anything you want to fly around. It takes sometime to create a good level but if you have the time the tools are there. Some other great levels are also available.
replyContent: Thank you for your review, I'm glad you like it!

content: Amazing graphics great maps great price
replyContent: Thank you for your review!

content: It's a super fun game with LOTS of potential. I do wish there was more maps. You can make your own which is awesome but it takes a while for a good map. And if your like me you would rather just get a map and not build. My only suggestion is more maps, or even being able to download other peoples maps. Edit: my bando one is super glitched. The building is pitch black and so is the ground. I have deleted it and re installed. Hope to see a fix. Edit: it's fixed!
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Yes I will probably make more maps later on. Still I encourage to make maps yourself, that way you can get the kind you want right away. It can even be fun :) Easiest way to get into it is by editing the built in levels, that way you don't have to start from scratch. Edit: new version hopefully fixes the bando one map.

content: Even better than the regular one and very close to the desktop version! The fact that I can import custom tracks from the desktop version is simply amazing!
replyContent: Thank you for your review, glad you like it! Glad you appreciate the possibility to import custom tracks from the desktop version.

content: The original FPV Freerider is simply best FPV mobile simulator. This expands the maps, and lets me have more fun while on the go. Initially the app kept crashing, but with advice from the developer to clear cache/data and reinstall,it worked. With that said you do need a powerful phone to run this as its more detailed. Recommend to run it in low resolution mode for lower end phones
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback, glad to hear that the solution worked and that you managed to get it running!

content: Terrible so glitch it's un playable frame rate is shocking. Yes have tryed adjusting to lowest settings and still the same it's unplayable and very laggy. Using latest hewaui p30 Pro phone. The original. Free rider worked fine on it so not sure why this latest one doesn't run smoothly
replyContent: You can try the latest update and see if it runs smoother. (I figured out that on a lot of devices the SSAO effect caused a massive performance drop, so I disabled it by default in the latest version). Also, I recommend enabling Performance Mode (if available) in your phone settings for better performance.

content: A well known fpv simulator in computer, now in your phone. This is the best simulator I've tried in my phone so far and the graphics were superb! I haven't flown my tiny whoop yet so I couldn't know if this game is very accurate to the real world, but overall worth the money! One suggestion is to make the game less laggy while maintaining the quality and the graphics of the game, the leaf movements of the trees are fascinating but I think it is not necessary as it also lags the game.
replyContent: Thank you for your review, I'm glad you like the simulator. I tried to keep the performance as good as possible while still having as nice graphics as possible. The movement of the leafs actually doesn't affect the performance very much, but the more detailed trees are quite demanding to render in themselves since they have a lot of geometry.

content: Love the PC edition and this is just as great. Using a cheap phone vr set with some cables it's great for fpv practice! Working great samsung A50
replyContent: Thank you for your review, I'm glad to hear that it's working well on your setup!

content: At first i thought this game would be fun but in the end it was super laggy . To me not worth it at all and the free freerider is so much better and smoother.😠 But luckily they have a refund!😁😁😁😁
replyContent: You can try the latest update and see if it runs better - SSAO is now turned off by default, it was a major performance hog. Selecting low resolution and lowest graphics quality in the main menu gives the best performance. Also, I recommend enabling Performance Mode (or similar feature) in your phone settings for better performance.
